channel.title: Few issues in my Qubes OS R3.2
channel.description:
Hello, first of all thank for the great work you are doing and sorry for the ignorance about what i'm asking for. Almost everything work fine except:
- When i start Qubes OS R 3.2 i always get "Failed to start Load Kernel Modules" and "systemctl status systemd-modules-load -l" gives me:
> $ systemctl status systemd-modules-load -l > ● systemd-modules-load.service - Load Kernel Modules > Loaded: loaded (/usr/lib/systemd/system/systemd-modules-load.service; static; vendor preset: disabled) > Active: failed (Result: exit-code) since dom 2017-02-12 02:35:48 CET; 30min ago > Docs: man:systemd-modules-load.service(8) > man:modules-load.d(5) > Process: 1098 ExecStart=/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-modules-load (code=exited, status=1/FAILURE) > Main PID: 1098 (code=exited, status=1/FAILURE)
> feb 12 02:35:47 dom0 systemd-modules-load[1098]: Module 'xen_evtchn' is builtin > feb 12 02:35:47 dom0 systemd-modules-load[1098]: Module 'xen_gntdev' is builtin > feb 12 02:35:47 dom0 systemd-modules-load[1098]: Module 'xen_gntalloc' is builtin > feb 12 02:35:48 dom0 systemd[1]: systemd-modules-load.service: Main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE > feb 12 02:35:48 dom0 systemd[1]: Failed to start Load Kernel Modules. > feb 12 02:35:48 dom0 systemd[1]: systemd-modules-load.service: Unit entered failed state. > feb 12 02:35:48 dom0 systemd[1]: systemd-modules-load.service: Failed with result 'exit-code'.
- The other two issues are about setting Qubes' Tor hidden service repositories for Fedora and Debian Templates. I'm following the documentation (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Security_Guide#Qubes_Packages) but i get this after giving the commands:
> Usage: qvm-run [options] `[<vm-name>] [<cmd>]`
> qvm-run: error: You must specify the VM name and the command to execute in the VM.
Thanks again for your time. I will make a donation as soon as possible for support :slight_smile:

item.title: Few issues in my Qubes OS R3.2
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Your welcome. No worries about that. Not easy to notice and also figuring out where to post what is not trivial for users.

Read full topic
item.source: Few issues in my Qubes OS R3.2

item.description:
I will do, sorry for the mistake, i didn’t notice their mailing list.

Read full topic

item.title: Few issues in my Qubes OS R3.2
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
The first issue is a general Qubes issue. Please use the Qubes support channels.

(As per https://forums.whonix.org/t/what-to-post-in-this-qubes-whonix-forum-and-what-not.)

Read full topic

item.description:
Well, thank you very much, it worked.

item.title: Few issues in my Qubes OS R3.2
item.dc:creator: eujan1
item.description:
Will leave your first issue to the experts.

As far as the qvm-run error for setting Tor repositories, you probably need to change $DebianTemplateVM to your applicable template, ie debian-8 and $FedoraTemplateVM to your applicable template, ie fedora-24.

Read full topic
item.source: Few issues in my Qubes OS R3.2

item.title: Few issues in my Qubes OS R3.2
item.dc:creator: cryptor
item.description:
Hello,
first of all thank for the great work you are doing and sorry for the ignorance about what i’m asking for.
Almost everything work fine except:

  • When i start Qubes OS R 3.2 i always get “Failed to start Load Kernel Modules” and “systemctl status systemd-modules-load -l” gives me:

$ systemctl status systemd-modules-load -l
● systemd-modules-load.service - Load Kernel Modules
Loaded: loaded (/usr/lib/systemd/system/systemd-modules-load.service; static; vendor preset: disabled)
Active: failed (Result: exit-code) since dom 2017-02-12 02:35:48 CET; 30min ago
Docs: man:systemd-modules-load.service(8)
man:modules-load.d(5)
Process: 1098 ExecStart=/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-modules-load (code=exited, status=1/FAILURE)
Main PID: 1098 (code=exited, status=1/FAILURE)

feb 12 02:35:47 dom0 systemd-modules-load[1098]: Module ‘xen_evtchn’ is builtin
feb 12 02:35:47 dom0 systemd-modules-load[1098]: Module ‘xen_gntdev’ is builtin
feb 12 02:35:47 dom0 systemd-modules-load[1098]: Module ‘xen_gntalloc’ is builtin
feb 12 02:35:48 dom0 systemd[1]: systemd-modules-load.service: Main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE
feb 12 02:35:48 dom0 systemd[1]: Failed to start Load Kernel Modules.
feb 12 02:35:48 dom0 systemd[1]: systemd-modules-load.service: Unit entered failed state.
feb 12 02:35:48 dom0 systemd[1]: systemd-modules-load.service: Failed with result ‘exit-code’.

  • The other two issues are about setting Qubes’ Tor hidden service repositories for Fedora and Debian Templates. I’m following the documentation (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Security_Guide#Qubes_Packages) but i get this after giving the commands:

Usage: qvm-run [options] [<vm-name>] [<cmd>]

qvm-run: error: You must specify the VM name and the command to execute in the VM.

Thanks again for your time. I will make a donation as soon as possible for support

Read full topic
item.source: Few issues in my Qubes OS R3.2
